Oh I do like to be beside the seaside!
 Oh I do like to be beside by the sea
 I do like to stroll upon the Prom, Prom, Prom!
 Where the brass band plays: “tiddely-om-pom-pom!”
 
 Oh I do like to be beside the seaside!
 Oh I do like to be beside by the sea
 When I’m down beside the sea, I’m beside meself with glee
 Beside the seaside! Beside the sea
These are lyrics from the British music hall song “I Do Like to Be Beside the Seaside”.

“Freddie Mercury: The Definitive Biography” describes Rhye as a fantasy land that Freddie dreamt up in childhood with his sister. They were living in Zanzibar and it’s been conjectured that they molded this world from a dream version of their immediate environment.

It is a recurring theme in Freddie’s work, appearing again in “Lily Of The Valley”, “My Fairy King”, and “The March Of The Black Queen”.
